One of the most basic skills every Civil Engineer should possess is 
 
the ability to survey and map a given site or location. AVENIR plans 
 
on putting this skill to the test by conducting a tracking event, where 
 
both the parameters i.e., length and bearing will be provided through 
 
problems. 
 
• The solution to the problem will provide the parameters i.e., length 
 
and bearing. 
 
• Participants need to use the parameters and surveying equipments 
 
and techniques to reach their objectives. 
 
• This is going to test the participant’s abilities to come up with quick 
 
solutions to field problems, besides testing their intelligence quotient. 
 
• All necessary equipments are going to be provided by the 
 
organizers. 
 
RULES AND REGULATIONS 
 
• Teams should consist of 4-5 members 
 
• The event is open to all 
 
• Use of calculators or any other electronic devices will lead to 
 
disqualification 
 
• The starting point and ending point of each team will be different. 
 
THE QUICKEST TEAM WILL BE DECLARED THE WINNERS. 
 
NOTE 1: The participants are going to be held responsible for any 
 
damages that might occur to the instruments during the competition. 
 
NOTE 2: Eligible for final round of SERVOLARE, each team will have to 
 
qualify for preliminary aptitude test. 
 
NOTE 3: The decision taken by organizers in any aspect will be final.
